description:
I installed on ubuntu 18.04 with:
$ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:apandada1/brightness-controller
$ sudo apt update
$ sudo apt install brightness-controller
The install looked successful, but the program launches with most of it's GUI greyed out or missing.
I had great hopes for this.  :(  My Samsung 24" TV is brighter & easier to see with Windows 7 or 10.

It is working fine on my system (ubuntu 18 and some cheap LG monitor)
There are two versions of this script, one is plain and simple, and another one is advanced with color temperature controls. You can find more info in their git and launch extended script from /usr/share/brightness-controller/init.py - it also gives you tray icon.
Also it conflicts with f.lux, so you'll have to close it.
it did not adjust my brightness dont install this software
Besonders geeignet um das Blaulicht zu regulieren
